description: Poputepipikku turns absurdist comedy up to eleven with its pop culture references and surreal hilarity. With two bonafide high school girl protagonists—the short and exceptionally quick to anger Popuko, and the tall and unshakably calm Pipimi—they throw genres against the wall and don't wait to see what sticks. Parody is interlaced with drama, action, crudeness, and the show's overarching goal—to become a real anime.
hashtag: #ポプテピピック #PPTP #竹書房 #クソアニメ

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

title.native: ポプテピピックTVスペシャル

Born 1981 in Okinawa, Japan
2000 Graduated from Okinawa prefectural High School and moved to Tokyo
2002 Enrolled in the Department of Design, Tokyo University of the Arts
2003 Started making independent animation films with a class assignment
In September of the same year, while working on his own projects, he formed TACOROOM, a video production team made up of five of his classmates. (dissolved in 2007)
2007 Graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts, Department of Design

(Source: aokijun.net)

[Website](https://thibaulttresca.weebly.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/thibaulttresca) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCZgWitf-tdNbhB8RbEOE4A)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uesaka_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uesaka_sumire) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/uesakasumire) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/uesaka_sumire/) | [Record Label Profile](http://king-cr.jp/artist/uesakasumire/)

Sumire entered the entertainment industry at the age of 9, when she was scouted by Space Craft's junior talent division. In 2009, she landed her first regular radio gig as host of Web Raji@Dengeki Bunko, and in 2011, she transferred to animation division of Space Craft due her interest in becoming a voice actress. On March 12, 2016, Sumire received the Best Rookie Actress award in the 10th Seiyuu Awards. She has also been a member of the seiyuu unit ".lady." since 2014.

Sumire is fluent in Russian and loves the Soviet culture, which she became interested in after hearing the State Anthem of the USSR in her first year of high school. In April 2010, Sumire entered the Faculty of Foreign Studies at Sophia University, and she majored in the Russian language there.

Sumire is interested in history and war figurines, particularly Russian/Soviet history, the Showa era, and likes the book Romance of the Three Kingdoms. She also has had a strong interest in games, anime and manga ever since she was a child. Her other interests consists of photography, lolita fashion-- she works as a lolita model-- and drawing, which she is quite good at. She also loves rock and heavy metal; her favorite bands are Metallica, Judas Priest, Black Sabbath, Dragonforce, and Kinniku Shoujo Tai. Additionally, Sumire is very good friends with fellow seiyuu [Sachika Misawa](https://anilist.co/staff/102337/Sachika-Misawa), who has called Sumire "her waifu".

**Non-anime roles:**
- Rosalie - Memento Mori (VG)
- Exia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Drake - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Profile (dandelion)](http://www.ddl-ltd.co.jp/watanabeyui.html) | [Website](https://yuiwatanabe.com/) | [Website (Tokuma)](https://www.tkma.co.jp/jpop_top/yuiwatanabe.html) | [Web Diary / Blog](http://ameblo.jp/yui-chupunch/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabeyui_Ton) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yui_Watanabe) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡部優衣)

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuiyui_makino) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/yui-makino/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_makino0119/) | [Website](http://www.yuiyuimakino.com/)

A Japanese voice actor, singer, and pianist. She married the singer-songwriter [Yutaro Miura](https://anilist.co/staff/182317/Yuutarou-Miura) on June 12, 2020. 
 
Makino took up piano at the age of four. Her talent was discovered by the film director Shunji Iwai when she was only seven years old, and from the age of 8 to 17, she played piano solos for three of his films, one of which was _Love Letter_. She then graduated from Tokyo College of Music as piano major in 2008 with the top score in her senior year piano ensemble.

Makino has appeared in two films, several commercials, and a TV Drama. She also sang the ending theme of a Wii game, Arc Rise Fantasia. The song, which she wrote the lyrics and music of herself, was titled "Tenshi no Hashigo ~crepuscular rays~".

She was nominated for "Best Young Seiyuu"  for her outstanding portrayal of Misaki Nakahara in Welcome To The N.H.K!.

**Non-Anime Roles**
- Zhezhi - Wuthering Waves (VG)

Singer and voice actor since February 2011. Used to have a complex about his feminine voice, but he got over it because people liked that type of unique voice.

Ryuunosuke Matsushita in _Kimi to Boku_ was his first anime role. He also sings many insert songs in the same anime. Ai Mikaze from _UtaPri_ series is the role that made him popular. Debuted with the mini-album "Blue Bird" on June 26, 2013.
